story.title: BC-US--Oil Pipeline-ETP Lawsuit,CLARIFICATION
story.summary: BISMARCK, N.D. (AP) — In a story March 2, The Associated Press reported that Earth First provided $500,000 to what became the Red Warrior Camp, a group that protested against the Dakota Access oil pipeline. The statement is an allegation by the...

xmlText.p: Eds: Editors who used BC-US--Oil Pipeline-ETP Lawsuit of March 2 may wish to use the following, which explains that an allegation that Earth First provided $500,000 to what became the Dakota Access pipeline protest faction the Red Warrior Camp was made by the pipeline developer, and attorneys for Earth First say there is no evidence of such a payment.

BISMARCK, N.D. (AP) — In a story March 2, The Associated Press reported that Earth First provided $500,000 to what became the Red Warrior Camp, a group that protested against the Dakota Access oil pipeline. The statement is an allegation by the pipeline developer, and attorneys for Earth First say there is no evidence of it.
